title: Who is Igor Lemeshkin?
lead: Igor Lemeshkin is a product designer focused on clarity, precision, and real impact.

sections.title: Igor designs.
lines: He creates sharp interfaces, streamlined systems, and intuitive interactions ‚Äî always grounded in real workflows, not trends.
He breaks down complexity, aligns tightly with development, and builds scalable solutions that last.

checklist.title: Seamless handoffs
checklist.description: Zero friction from concept to code

sections.title: He also codes.
lines: Can we call him a good coder? Sure. For example, he designed and built this very website in no time.
But to him, it's all design. Labels don't mean much. As automation spreads, the ones who stay ahead are those who think across disciplines and make the right calls.
Igor's edge comes from sharp, distinctly human decisions, rooted in rich multidisciplinary experience. With that, he is stepping into roles of the future.

facts.title: Invented a Design Pattern
facts.text: At iMusician, Igor pioneered the ‚Äúeverything is a field‚Äù system ‚Äî reducing clutter, scaling fast, and making users and devs actually happy.

facts.title: Designed for Scale, Not Screenshots
facts.text: His design system works across 5 products with different tech stacks ‚Äî and still feels like one

facts.title: Bridged Design + Engineering
facts.text: No handoff drama. Igor collaborates deep with devs to make sure what ships matches what's dreamed.

facts.title: Business-Savvy by Design
facts.text: Degree in Business Informatics. Knows how product decisions affect the bottom line ‚Äî and designs accordingly.

facts.title: Prototyped. Validated. Shipped.
facts.text: Rapid prototyping wasn't a phase ‚Äî it happens weekly. Igor made fast feedback loops the norm.

facts.title: Full-Stack Thinker
facts.text: From high-level flows to front-end code, Igor doesnt stop at UI ‚Äî he designs how the product works.

sections.title: Side Skills & Achievements
lines: Igor is always chasing new hobbies. But no matter where he wanders, he always circles back to his first love: design.
And yes, every side quest adds a little something extra to the way he does it.
